original_title: Moves to reinstate members of LG bodies against democratic principles: NPP
original_body_lines: National People's Power (NPP) will not allow the proposed Act to be passed in Parliament to reinstate members of the expired Local Government bodies as it is against democratic principles, NPP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

Speaking at the NPP convention of the Wattala electorate, he said SLPP MP Jayantha Ketagoda has moved a Private Member’s Bill to reinstate members and heads of LG bodies as the LG polls are yet to be held.
He said it was against democratic principles to reinstate former members and that only the members elected by the people had a right to represent them in local bodies.

“Members of Local Government bodies cannot be reinstated through an Act passed in Parliament. It can only be done through the people’s mandate. We will not allow the government to paly with the people’s mandate,” he said.
Dissanayake said the people should be given the right to elect their representatives in a democratic country.(Ajith Siriwardana)
